FuncDef:
The process-interface-status command associates the status of a BFD session with the status of the interface to which the BFD session is bound.
The undo process-interface-status command cancels the association between the status of a BFD session and the status of the interface to which the BFD session is bound. The process-interface-status command associates the status of a BFD session with the status of the interface to which the BFD session is bound. The undo process-interface-status command cancels the association between the status of a BFD session and the status of the interface to which the BFD session is bound. By default, the status of the multicast IP single-hop BFD session is not associated with the status of the bound interface, and the status of the link-bundle single-hop BFD session is associated with the status of the bound interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Associates a BFD session with a sub-interface. If a BFD session is bound to an interface, the BFD session status change affects the status of this interface and its sub-interfaces.
This parameter applies only to multicast IP single-hop BFD sessions.
-

Indicates that the BFD session bound to an interface or sub-interface does not trigger the interface or sub-interface to go down when the initial state is Down after configuration restoration.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI] bfd test bind link-bundle peer-ip 10.1.1.2 interface Eth-Trunk 1 source-ip 10.1.1.1
[*HUAWEI] bfd s1 bind peer-ip default-ip interface 100GE 1/0/1
ExtraInfo: When transmission devices exist on a link and a fault occurs on the link, the devices on both ends of the link need a long time to detect the fault. To shorten the fault detection time, run the process-interface-status command to associate a multicast BFD session with an interface to trigger fast route convergence.
